H0.text: Heat is what plants give off as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe, just as animals give off carbon dioxide that plants take in through leaves.

H1.text: Oxygen is what plants give off as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe, after animals give off carbon dioxide that plants take in through their leaves.

H2.text: Protein is what plants give off as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe, following the process where animals give off carbon dioxide that plants take in through leaves.

H3.text: Water is what plants give off as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe, while animals give off carbon dioxide that plants take in through leaves.

A4.text: Photosynthesis releases oxygen as a byproduct of water splitting.

A5.text: Photosynthesis plays a critical role in producing and maintaining the oxygen content of the Earth's atmosphere.
